intro: Pyrus leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited pear, is a species of flowering plant in the genus Pyrus. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its small, white, edible fruits. The plant produces white flowers in the spring, which are followed by the development of its distinctive fruits. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters. The leaves are alternate, simple, and have a serrated margin, contributing to its ornamental value.
